item.title: argparse - modern Python command line arguments
item.description: If you search for information on how to write Python modules that accepts command line arguments, you are very likely to stumble upon sys.argv and getopt() and go with it. But since Python 3.2 there is a better alternative that requires less boilerplate and less re-inventing the wheel: argparse. Just like getopt() argparse relies on sys.argv but it is more high-level and provides more functionality out of the box. At the core of argparse is the class ArgumentParser, which returns an object that you can use to create the argument interface.
